definition: to suddenly realize/to suddenly see the light
a sudden realization/to realize sth in a flash

sentences.english: It suddenly occurred to the bird that it was the most fantastic idea for birds to catch up with man.
sentences.chinese: 它恍然明白，鸟意欲赶追人类是多么异想天开。

sentences.english: Clothes and quilt are permeated with damp senses, like being in the south.
sentences.chinese: 衣被都开始氤氲着潮湿气味，恍然间如置身南国。

sentences.english: And we realized, you know, they could be influencing each other.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们就恍然大悟，这两者之间可以相互影响。

sentences.english: I have recently been disabused of this notion.
sentences.chinese: 而最近我对这种观念恍然大悟。

sentences.english: Demeter came, but it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 得墨忒尔恍然大悟，但为时已晚。

sentences.english: There was a round of forehead slaps from the other Team-members.
sentences.chinese: 其他的团队成员恍然大悟。

sentences.english: Listen to her words everyone suddenly enlighted, turns out to be a misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 听了她的话大家恍然大悟，原来是一场误会。

sentences.english: Come to realize, the Bana open, bloody flower, the extradition of the Lost souls.
sentences.chinese: 恍然间，彼岸花开，血色花蕊，引渡着迷惘的游魂。

sentences.english: I am suddenly enlighted, the human not only wants to go on living, but also good work crisper.
sentences.chinese: 我恍然大悟，人不仅要活下去，还好活得更爽些。

sentences.english: Soon, too soon, she left and started her own life.
sentences.chinese: 恍然间，她离开了我建立了自己的生活。

sentences.english: The importance of bionics suddenly hits you .
sentences.chinese: 你就会对仿生学的重要性恍然大悟。

sentences.english: With a great "ah ha!" we return to our Amazon spokeswoman.
sentences.chinese: 带着恍然大悟，我们回来看亚马逊的女发言人。

sentences.english: Mother said it is autumn, I recognized suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈说已经立秋，我也恍然大悟。

sentences.english: His friend suddenly saw the light and then his illness was cured right off.
sentences.chinese: 朋友恍然大悟，一直治不好的重病一下子就好了。

sentences.english: Mr. Wong's speech about U.S./ China policy seemed to be an eye opener.
sentences.chinese: 王先生的中美政策讲演使人恍然大悟。

definition: to suddenly realize/to suddenly see the light
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to realize suddenly/to wake up with a start
to come to oneself/to come to realize/to come to see the truth/to wake up to reality
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to collect one's thoughts (after being surprised or shocked)/to snap out of it (after being lost in thought)
